pageContext.claim: “This year, 40 million American families will benefit from the Republican child tax credit, each receiving an average of over $2,200 dollars.”
pageContext.analysis: This is an example of Trump using correct numbers, but he gives too much credit to himself and his Republican colleagues. The child tax credit has existed since 1997, and it's been expanded since then, including in the recent tax law. In 2016, under President Barack Obama, 35 million American families took the tax credit, with an average benefit of over $1,500 a year, according to the Treasury Department. So there's only been a modest increase (in part because of inflation).
